notes: GMT900 platform Silverado 1500 (2007-2013). All-new body-on-frame architecture. Active Fuel Management (cylinder deactivation) on 5.3L and 6.0L engines. Hybrid model available (2007-2013) with 6.0L Vortec + electric motors (332 hp combined). Six-speed automatics standard from 2009. Electronic throttle control. Timing chain on all engines. DoD/AFM lifter failure common on 5.3L. Data sourced from Wikipedia Chevrolet Silverado GMT900 article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 6.6L Duramax LMM diesel V8 (365 hp, 660 lb-ft, 2007-2010)

notes: GMT900 platform Silverado HD (2007-2014). Heavy-duty truck with Duramax diesel option. LMM Duramax (2007-2010) with DPF exhaust aftertreatment. LML Duramax (2011+) with DEF (urea) injection for emissions. Allison 1000 six-speed automatic with diesel. CP4.2 high-pressure fuel pump on LML. Independent front torsion bar suspension. Difficulty 1.2 due to Duramax diesel complexity, DPF/DEF systems, and CP4.2 fuel pump failures. Data sourced from Wikipedia Chevrolet Silverado GMT900 article, January 2025 revision.

K2XX platform Silverado 1500 (2014-2018). All-new EcoTec3 engine family with direct injection and cylinder deactivation. Eight-speed automatic (8L90) introduced 2015. Aluminum hood and tailgate for weight reduction. Magnetic Ride Control suspension optional. Variable valve timing on all engines. Direct injection carbon buildup on intake valves. Timing chains on all engines. AFM/DFM lifter issues continue. Data sourced from Wikipedia Chevrolet Silverado K2XX article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 6.6L Duramax L5P diesel V8 (445 hp, 910 lb-ft, 2017-2019)
notes: K2XX platform Silverado HD (2015-2019). All-new L5P Duramax diesel introduced 2017 (445 hp, 910 lb-ft) - first Duramax without EGR cooler. Allison 1000 six-speed automatic with diesel.
